data.event: The first mention of a settlement on the site of Brody is dated 1084 (Instructions by Volodymyr Monomach).

event.title: was granted Magdeburg rights and city status in 1584

data.event: Brody was granted Magdeburg rights and city status in 1584.
From 1629, the city became the property of Stanisław Koniecpolski, who ordered the construction of Brody Castle (1630–1635).

data.event: In 1648, during the Cossack insurrection, the castle took eight weeks for Bohdan Khmelnytsky to capture.
